thread.title_full: Ray the lonely fisherman taken on all expenses paid angling trip by kind young friend

author: Helena Horton
title: Ray the lonely fisherman taken on all expenses paid angling trip by kind young friend
text:
Ray the lonely fisherman taken on all expenses paid angling trip by kind young friend 22 year old Mati Batsinilas stepped up to the plate Credit: Mati Batsinilas/Facebook Helena Horton  38am 
T he heartbreaking story of Ray the lonely fisherman who was looking for a new friend after his fishing companion died has a happy ending. 
After an online campaign to find the widower from Lewiston in South Australia a friend, a 22-year-old Brisbane man stepped up to the plate. 
Mati Batsinilas took the 75-year-old on the fishing trip of a lifetime - and they certainly reeled in some whoppers. Ray and his new friends Credit: Facebook/Mati Batsinilas 
T hey caught some massive whiting on their trip, and Ray made a number of new friends. 
The two have planned another trip together four-wheel-driving to catch beachworms on Wednesday. 
"I offered him a holiday away — and not just for fishing, but to get away and relax" Mr Batsinilas told ABC. 
"I said from the beginning to Ray that we would get there and that I would commit to it and do it." 
He said the weather was perfect and that it was great to see the elderly man smile. 
Ray posted on Gumtree last week to ask for companionship. Watch | Giant tuna fetches £500,000 at Tsukiji New Year's fish auction 00:48 
A ppealing for a fishing enthusiast "in a similar position to myself," Ray wrote: "I am a land-based fisherman. I have all the gear for all types of fish that is required for land-based fishing. 
"I am willing to share all costs, e.g. petrol, bait, and should you happen to own a boat [am] willing to pay all ramp fees, but happy if you are also a land-based fisherman." 
He rounded off the ad with the suggestion that anyone interested could contact him to "arrange a meeting to see if we could get along with each other."
